DataElement.preferredName: Performed Study Activity Date and Time Validation Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded value specifying the degree of authoritativeness or certiitude of the date of the activity. EXAMPLE(S): date estimated, date greater than 100 days - day is correct, date known, date less than 100 days - date is correct, date previously reported NOTE(S): The concept of "date unknown" is captured by a null flavor of "UNK" on the date range attribute, rather than a code in this attribute.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Performed Study Activity Date and Time Validation Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active._An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The act of validating; finding or testing the truth of something.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active.

Concepts.definition: Executed and carried through to completion.

An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The act of validating; finding or testing the truth of something.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

The act of validating; finding or testing the truth of something.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
